wikipedia_page.main:
Barron George Merriman Cangley (12 September 1922 – 2015) was an English cricketer. Cangley was a right-handed batsman. 
He was born at Blakesley, Northamptonshire in September 1922. In 1946, Cangley represented Cambridgeshire in 2 Minor Counties Championship matches against Norfolk and Bedfordshire.Cangley also played first-class cricket, where he represented Cambridge University in 8 first-class matches, making his debut for the University against Sussex and playing his final first-class match against Oxford University.  All 8 of his first-class matches came in 1947.  In his 8 first-class matches, he scored 295 runs at a batting average of 22.69, with a single half century high score of 76.He died in 2015 in Victoria, Australia.
